name: Matcha and Hojicha Cookies
description: Soft and chewy homemade hojicha cookies
instructions: Use a hand mixer to whisk together softened butter with sugar until light and fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla extract and mix until combined.
Seperate the wet ingredients into two sections. In one section, add half of the wet ingredients to one bowl. Add the rest of the wet ingredients to a seperate bowl.
In a another bowl, sift and/or whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Seperate the dry ingredients into two sections. In one section, add the hojicha powder and in the other section, add the matcha powder. Whisk until homogenous.
Add dry ingredients in sections to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. You should now have two different doughs: hojicha and matcha.
Make ~40-50g dough chunks and roll them into balls.
Place the balls on a tray lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Flatten slightly.
Place the prepared cookies in the dridge for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 355°F and bake the cookies for 12 minutes.

name: Matcha and Hojicha Macarons
description: Soft and chewy homemade matcha cookies.
instructions: Use a hand mixer to whisk together softened butter with sugar until light and fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla extract and mix until combined.
In a seperate bowl, sift and/or whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, matcha powder, and salt.
Add dry ingriedients in sectios to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Make ~40-50g dough balls and roll them into balls.
Place the balls on a tray lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Flatten slightly.
Place the prepared cookies in the dridge for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 355°F and bake the cookies for 12 minutes.
